title.rendered: Exness Wins Double Honours at FMAS 2024: Best Multi-Asset Broker and Most Trusted Broker in Africa

content.rendered:
Exness, a leading global broker, has achieved significant recognition at the Finance Magnates Africa Summit (FMAS) 2024, earning the titles of Best Multi-Asset Broker and Most Trusted Broker in Africa.

These awards reinforce Exness’s prominent position in the African financial sector and highlight its dedication to client-focused services and innovative trading solutions.

Commitment to Frictionless Trading

As the Africa Partner of the summit, Exness unveiled its recent rebranding, emphasizing its commitment to providing a seamless trading experience powered by advanced technology. The company’s cutting-edge products made a strong impression on attendees.

“These awards validate our efforts to provide traders with an excellent experience and optimal trading conditions,” said Paul Margarites, Regional Commercial Director at Exness. “Africa is a crucial growth market for us, and this recognition highlights our dedication to the region and aligns with our rebrand values of ethics and technology.”

Industry Leadership and Insights

In addition to receiving awards, Exness participated in key discussions aimed at advancing the industry. Terence Hove, Senior Financial Markets Strategist at Exness, delivered an insightful presentation on the impact of economic and political developments on key assets, titled “Gold, South African Rand, and the 2024 Outlook.” He also led a Trader Zone Workshop, offering strategic analysis for traders interested in Gold and USDZAR, ensuring participants gained valuable knowledge.

Paul Margarites also joined the panel discussion “Business Growth in Africa and Beyond,” focusing on market opportunities and navigating Africa’s regulatory landscape.

Raising Industry Standards

Exness combines technology and ethics to set new standards in the industry, providing traders with a smooth trading experience through its advanced proprietary platform and unique market protections. This approach ensures traders can fully engage with the markets under optimal conditions.
